name: Great Moments And Images From Classic Movies Quiz | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: A legendary part of the movies is the chase. The best chase sequences I've seen are in 'Bullitt' and 'The French Connection'. Where do these stories take place?
questions.explanation:
San Francisco, New York.

	San Francisco with its rolling {hills;} New York chasing the train.

questions.text: The most impressive spectacles that I've seen are in the Charlton Heston epics: 'The Ten Commandments' (the parting of the Red Sea) and 'Ben-Hur' (the Chariot Race). Heston won the race; who lost?
A memorable romantic scene involves Burt Lancaster in a romantic moment on the beach in 'From Here to Eternity'. Who is the woman?
questions.explanation:
Deborah Kerr.

	Reed was also in the movie.

questions.text: A memorable part of a movie is often the theme song. The best I can think of is from 'The Magnificent Seven'. Who is the man responsible for the score?
Panoramic vistas often add to the movie; David Lean is noted for his sweeping panoramic shots. Which movie is NOT his?
questions.explanation:
The Last Wave.

	Peter Weir did that one.

questions.text: Some movies are memorable because of the way they begin. Which movie begins with a murder?
questions.explanation:
Mildred Pierce.

	The others all have murders, but they happen later in the movie.

questions.text: Other movies are memorable because of the way they end. Which movie ends with a fiery explosion?
Other movies, of course, have memorable lines. Which line is NOT correctly matched with the movie from which it comes?
questions.correct: Marlon Brando - 'Streetcar Named Desire' - 'I could have been a contender.'
options: Dustin Hoffman - 'The Graduate' - 'You're trying to seduce me ... aren't you?'
Bette Davis - 'All About Eve' - 'Fasten your seat belts, it's going to be a bumpy night.'
Clark Gable - 'Gone With The Wind' - 'Frankly my dear ...'
questions.explanation:
Marlon Brando - 'Streetcar Named Desire' - 'I could have been a contender.'

	It was Brando, but in 'On The Waterfront'.

questions.text: Other movies have memorable images. One great image is of the wise, old prospector in 'Treasure of the Sierra Madre' dancing when he discovers gold. Who played him?
questions.explanation:
Walter Huston.

	Great scene; great movie.

questions.text: Many movies go for the scary stuff. All of these feature someone being menaced by animals or supernatural forces EXCEPT ...?
questions.explanation:
Psycho.

	It's the supernatural at work in 'Exorcist'. A gorilla does it in 'Kong'. Rats are at work in 'Willard'. But, in 'Psycho', it's the human (but decidedly strange) Tony Perkins.
